711426f-a.text:
(1)
18th Street, south side, between Avenue A and First Avenue.
May 8, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
A closer and more limited view of the same. The Bull's Head Horse Auction Company is at 424-6 East 18th Street.
May 8, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

715868f-a.text:
Avenue A at S. E. corner of 18th Street.
May 8, 1929.
P. L. Sperr, Photographer

715869f-a.text:
(1) 279-303 Avenue A, west side between 18th and 19th Streets. These are one-story structures separated by an alley, at the end of which is a frame shack.
1932
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 118.

(2) A close-up of the frame shack at the end of the alley. This will still stand in 1934.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 119.

711425f-a.text:
18th Street at N.E. corner of Avenue A. In the foreground is the lumber yard at 505-7 East 18th Street.
May 15, 1929.
P.L. Sperr.
